boardgame.name: Arawn
boardgame.description:
Object: Capture the opponent's King

The game is played on an 8x8 board. The pieces consists of 1 King and 8 Warriors for each side.

How a Warrior moves varies depending on the number of Warriors for its side that are left on the board. The less Warriors you have, the more powerful they become.

8 - Steps forward (in the 3 - diagonal & straight - forward directions)
7 - Steps diagonally
6 - Steps orthogonally
5 - Slides diagonally
4 - Slides orthogonally
3 - Slides diagonally + steps orthogonally
2 - Slides orthogonally + steps diagonally
1 - Slides orthogonally + slides diagonally

The King moves by stepping orthogonally and diagonally.

Captures are mandatory and are done by replacement, like Chess.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lands of Legends
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

So, the time of telling tales is at end. Still interested? Of course not all tales end with the hero marrying the princess, but hey! Who ever said that life was fair anyway? Ah, of course it may just be the tale of a lowly peasant's son, but then again it might be the tale of the same son becoming prince… Let us see what fate will bring to you, shall we?

Ok, first of all we'll explain how to make the character you begin with, We will suppose he is at level one. Then we'll explain how to increase your level, and what happens when you do. To start your character you'll first have to roll the attributes. They tell you what your potential is, how strong you are, how fast and how bright, and if you are gifted for magic.

boardgame.name: Dragon Land
boardgame.description:
Adventure in Dragonland! The dragons store their treasure in the numerous volcanoes, but their treasure is in danger because the volcanoes will soon erupt! To save the treasure, the dragons have asked the dwarves, elves, humans, and magicians for help. Each group competes with the others to be the most successful at gathering treasure for the dragons.

Using strategy and cunning in Dragonland, each player moves their group of companions from volcano to volcano to collect sets of dragon eggs and gemstones. Each player scores points for each gemstone and egg, but extra points for a complete set: egg, ruby, emerald, and sapphire. All their movements are under the control of the tower of destiny, which sometimes arranges for a companion to reach their destination a bit too late. When the last egg is collected, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

For this edition of Dragonland, some new features have been added, specifically a unicorn mechanism and token and a witch mechanism and token. In addition, the game features completely new art and graphic design.

—description from publisher

Title: Dragonland Publisher: Gamelyn Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Legend Weaver: The Making of Heroes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[Legend Weaver] is a game of high fantasy. The player takes the persona of a hero and tries to advance in skills and gain personal wealth while saving people of the world from fates worse than death.

Sounds great in practice and a lot like a dozen other systems out there. So the question is: what makes Legend Weaver different from other game systems? Well to start with, it's free. Just download the rules and print the manuals, including the world background and scenarios. The world is diversified and the mythos that drives the universe is as open ended as you are going to find. Anything, you can imagine will fit into the game universe, with very little effort required to adapt it to the world or to the system.

User summary:

The game is published as six separate PDF files:


Section 1 of 5: Generating a Character (27 pp)
Section 2 of 5: Character Races (27 pp)
Section 3 of 5: Skills (35 pp)
Section 4 of 5: Combat (44 pp)
Section 5 of 5: Magic Part A, How it Works (15 pp)
Section 5 of 5: Magic Part B, Spells (30 pp)

boardgame.name: Legend Weaver: The Future of Combat
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Legend Weaver: The Future of Combat features a set of generic rules that allow you to fight a table top battle using any figures you own.

User summary:

Legend Weaver: The Future of Combat is the mass-combat system used with Legend Weaver. While it dovetails nicely with the roleplaying game, it also can function as a standalone tabletop miniatures wargame.

The game is published as four separate PDF files with two additional PDF supporting files.


Section 1 of 4: Introduction and Basic Figure Conversion (14 pp)
Section 2 of 4: Weapon Conversion (50 pp)
Section 3 of 4: Game Setup (3 pp)
Section 4 of 4: Main Rules (26 pp)
Cards (print-and-play) (3 pp)
Markers (print-and-play) (1 pp)

boardgame.name: Legendary Deities
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Legendary Deities of Panjere is published in seven separate PDF files - one for each deity.


Dionysus
Hussar
Kezia
Klatou
Melchior
Nova
Saber

boardgame.name: Top Trumps Quiz: FC Schalke 04
boardgame.description:
QUIZ Schalke 04 “Blue and white, how I love you”

Prove your passion now with the QUIZ Schalke 04!
All information about the club and its players is brought together here.
So kick off and let's go! If your greatest passion is soccer and you don't miss a game of the Royal Blues, then we have just the right thing for 2 players or teams from 6 years of age. Because in this QUIZ your memory will be put to the test twice with a total of 500 questions.
In the first round, each player or team draws five cards. Read the first question out to you one at a time. If only one of you has the correct answer, he receives the card. If both are correct, it continues until one answers the question incorrectly. If both players or teams do not know the answer to the first question or answer all five questions correctly, the cards land in the middle. Now you continue with the next card and if you can answer the question correctly while your opponent is wrong, you will receive the stack of cards from the middle. Whoever has collected three cards wins the first round. In the second round you shuffle the ten cards you have already played, distribute them again among you and play the cards again. If your little head is not only an absolute ace in the header, but was also able to remember most of the first round and collect three cards again, you win the game.

boardgame.name: The Town of Sandpoint
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

This is where the adventure sequence starts. The town of Sandpoint and Shanley's Keep will be the main two areas the group will call home. This document describes the town of Sandpoint. The support documents describe key areas within the town including the Chancellor's Mansion, the town's Three Inns and the Magic Users Tower. Combat sheets are provided for those in town who can fight. Personalities for other major NPCs are listed in the documents themselves.

User summary:

The scenario is published in thirteen separate PDF files.

boardgame.name: The Trip to Shanley's Keep
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

The group is board and out of money. Looking over the area, they find their options are limited until a Caravan hits town. Seems the owner Bernard has need of a scouting party though mums the word on what happened to the last one he had! The group is hired by Bernard and given the task of scouting out ahead of the caravan. The adventure begins...

User summary:

The scenario is published in fourteen separate PDF files.

boardgame.name: Shanley's Keep
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

The Caravan makes its way towards the mountains. Its first major stop is Shanley's Keep. This Keep / Tower / Fort holds the largest human population within 80 miles. The Keeps owner, Shanley, buys the character's contracts from Bernard. The characters are here to stay... if they can survive!

User summary:

The scenario is published in twelve separate PDF files.

boardgame.name: The Mosque
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Shanley's first job for the group is to scout out and bring back information on what Orcs might be in the area. The group will eventually track a set of Orcs to the Mosque. As they watch, the Orcs disappear into the building never to return...

User summary:

The scenario is published in six separate PDF files.

boardgame.name: The Rock
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Shanley has come by some information and now knows the rough location of the group of Orcs he was hoping the group would find their last trip out. He calls a meeting and sends them to investigate the reports that a new Orc colony has been established. Information is all he wants although he would never be one to discourage the killing of an Orc or two...

User summary:

The scenario is published in eleven separate PDF files.

boardgame.name: Adventure Sequence
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Legend Weaver: Adventure is presented as an adventure path, though there are numerous ways it can be played. This Adventure Sequence is a general overview of the places and people that comprise the series.

boardgame.name: The World of Panjere
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Panjere is an ancient world huge and full of magic. For over 18,000 years the Dark God Darkheim has stood in his castle and waged a war against the "civilized" lands of the world. Through two great purgings his minions have survived and now continue to grow and expand, fighting and winning lands that where once fully controlled by the Humans and their allies. Darkheim knows that the time of the final Armageddon approaches. Darkheim will avenge the death of his son and he will see that his son's mate, Demon, rules of the world.

They shall pay, he whispers to the wind, a whisper you hear late at night when your soul is quiet.

A whisper from a God that turns dreams to nightmares.

For you know, the horde comes.

User summary:

The World of Panjere is published as five separate PDF files.

boardgame.name: Lights, Camera, Action!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Trailers are the best of what all too many films have to offer. Not so with this game. Lights, Camera, Action! gives you a chance to become a celebrated actor, actress or director, at least within the confines of your campaign. Tired of Hollywood's calculated-to-appeal products? You can do better right here.

boardgame.name: Powergame (4th Edition)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Powergame was originally designed to be the definitive superhero roleplaying game for munchkins and powergamers. I never imagined that someone might want to use it for more or less serious campaigns. However, having witnessed such a miracle more than once, I gave the idea some thought. To my surprise I found out that there was indeed a decent system buried under the silliness. If there really are people who want to put Powergame into serious use, they deserve all the help I can give.

boardgame.name: Powergame (3rd Edition)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the ultimate game for munchkin players and power-hungry GMs.
...
The character creation rules are the biggest improvement in this edition. They now allow you to create "super normals", heroes without supernatural powers, and those munchkin-friendly "generic" characters (remember Hyperman?). However, to balance this, "generics" are now somewhat less powerful.

boardgame.name: Powergame NPC Catalog
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The NPC Catalog - parts one through four - present pre-generated NPCs for the game. The Catalog is published in four HTML pages:


One - 2 NPCs - for Powergame (3rd Edition)
Two - 5 NPCs - for Powergame (3rd Edition)
Three - 3 NPCs - for Powergame (3rd Edition)
Four - 6 NPCs - for Powergame (4th Edition)


One, Two, and Three are written by Mikko Kauppinen; Four is written by Mike Jacobs.

boardgame.name: Lint!
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Lint! is a fantasy roleplaying game.

Characters in the game primarily are defined by Attributes, including Appearance, Education, Health, Intellect, Personality, Speed, and Strength. Attributes have a numeric rating running from 1 to 10 (and are randomly generated).

Characters also have several derived values, including Avoidance, Hit Power, Weapon Power, Damage, and Hit Level. These are mathematically calculated from Attribute ratings - and all are for use in combat.

Characters have a Profession, which offers general flavor and a few benefits (usually combat benefits). Professions include Astrologer, Forester, Healer, Mage, Smith, and Warrior. Healers and Mages are capable of casting spells.

Characters will belong to one of three species - Human, Pooka, or Tree People.

Generally, the rules are confined to combat operations, though the game also assumes a general campaign and typical fantasy setting will be used.

boardgame.name: Business Wizards!
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

A roleplaying game in the Arcane World of Business!

In the same vain as Kobolds Ate My Baby! this new Polymorph title brings much silliness and a meta take on both BUSINESS and WIZARDS!!! Fans of Kobolds Ate My Baby and other Polymorph games will both LOVE clocking into this adventure!

In Business Wizards you are a BIZARD! That means you are wizard who is ALL BUSINESS! You solve your daily problems with magic and sorcery rather than good old fashioned work ethic!

Do you love a challenge? Can you cast legendary spells on time and under budget? Are your illusionary projections actually illusions? Join a magically powered up team with flexible hours and competitive treasure/experience share. Only highly proficient communicators and ace spellcasters need apply. Experience with Crystal Balls, PCs and NPCs is a plus.
​
In Business Wizards you can:


Attend STAFF meetings
Get mad at the MIMIC copier
Chat around the GELATINOUS CUBE cooler
Summon COFFEE
...and much more!


User summary:

Scheduled to ship in November 2020.

boardgame.name: La Lutte Des Gemmes
boardgame.description:
User summary:

La Lutte des Gemmes is a French-language roleplaying game. The game is set in a fairly traditional medieval fantasy genre. The game is unusual inasmuch as it provides components to enable mass combat and even naval combat.

La Lutte des Gemmes originally was commercially published, and later released in HTML format under a GNU Free Documentation License.

The HTML version presents a compilation of core rules, setting, resources, adventures, and even a GM screen. These are presented over multiple HTML pages, including:

Introduction
Chap. 1 : Origine Du Peuple Et Création Du Village
Chap. 2 : Le Monde Actuel Et Les Joueurs
Chap. 3 : Les Agents
Chap. 4 : Physique Et Psychique
Chap. 5 : Connaissances Professions Et Castes
Chap. 6 : Description Des Castes Et Professions
Chap. 7 : Hors Castes
Chap. 8 : Les Mutations
Chap. 9 : Persos Minute
Chap. 10 : Climat Et Durées
Chap. 11 : Utiliser Ses Compétences
Chap. 12 : Compétences Générales
Chap. 13 : Description Des Compétences
Chap. 14 : Les Compétences De Méditation
Chap. 15 : Progrésser-régresser
Chap. 16 : Peurs, Terreurs Et Equilibre Mental
Chap. 17 : Déplacements Et Encombrement
Chap. 18 : Résistance Des Objets Et Équipement
Chap. 19 : Les Combats
Chap. 20 : Blessures Et Soins
Chap. 21 : Mort Du Personnage
Chap. 22 : Navigation Et Wargame Naval
Chap. 23 : La Magie
Chap. 24 : Les Rencontres Et Le Bestiaire
Chap. 25 : Scénarii Et Aventures
Chap. 26 : Le Monde Mystique
Chap. 27 : L'écran Du Maître De Jeu

boardgame.name: Five Options from the Notepad: Optional rules for Five Parsecs
boardgame.description:
This expansion pack offers new optional rules for your games of Five Parsecs From Home.

Included is

an alternate approach to close combat,
rules for adopting a defensive stance in combat,
a new (risky) option for firing while dashing,
an alternate approach to armor,
a new hit point system if you want a more RPG-style experience
and finally random AI tables to make your gun fights more unpredictable.


While designed for Five Parsecs From Home 2nd edition, these options should be adaptable to other Five X systems as well.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Galactic War: Starship Rules
boardgame.description:
A game of battles in deep space stats are included for a number of human and alien factions.

The rules use a simple system of opposed dice rolls any advantages or disadvantages simply add more dice, the game uses various different dice D4,6,8,10 and 10 and ideally you will need a couple of each/player.

Hopefully fun and easy to play the different factions abilities should make for some varied games with different challenges.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Angela & Enchantress
boardgame.description:
Amora the Enchantress has devoted her immortal life to the pusuit of power. One of the most powerful magic-wielders in Asgard, Amora is well known for her immense beauty and infamous for her heartless scheming in order to get whatever she desires. Able to enact powerful charms, the Enchantress is able to bend even the strongest resolve to her will.

Firstborn of Odin and Freyja, Angela was kidnapped by Heven during the war between Heven and Asgard. Thought dead by her parents, Angela was raised and trained to be one of Heven’s deadliest hunters and warriors. Having learned of her true parentage, Angela cast aside her loyalty to Heven and to Odin, choosing to serve no master but her own conscience. She nor travels the cosmos fighting against any evil which dares cross her path, both alongside her brother Thor, and as part of the Guardians of the Galaxy.

Box contains:

1 Angela Miniature
1 Enchantress Miniature
2 Bases
2 Character Stat Cards
3 Team Tactic Cards
10 Tokens

listing.notes: Title: Marvel: Crisis Protocol - Angela & Enchantress Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Gaming Paper Tiles
boardgame.description:
From website:

Set of 4 Gaming Paper Tiles 8×11 Grid/Grid

2018 ENnies Silver Winner

Draw, Erase, Draw Again

Whip up a quick random encounter using Gaming Paper Tiles and dry-erase markers.

Description:
Why Gaming Paper Tiles?

Easy to use and transport; Similar size as all of your gaming books

Fits together side by side to make larger room, combine sets to make huge rooms

Reveal only what you want your players to see

Inexpensive and reusable

Up to 16″ x 22″ of game space

boardgame.name: Dry Erase Dungeon Tiles, Earthtone
boardgame.description:
From the website:

This package of Role 4 Initiative Dungeon Tiles contains 9 10-inch Earthtone tiles that interlock like puzzle pieces. Compatible with dry-erase, wet-erase, and even liquid chalk markers.

More flexible than a traditional battle mat, start your game with a single tile and connect the tiles as the adventurers explore new areas.

Never again give away clues as to which way the corridors may lead due to starting placement on a large mat.

The 10" modularity allows the Dungeon Master to draw many details of an area at his seat and then simply hand the tile to the nearest player to connect.

Take advantage of the double-side feature by pre-drawing map features before the game and only revealing tiles as they are encountered. You can draw one side as it appears naturally, and the other side that shows all the hidden traps and magic features when they are triggered.

Also available in a pack of 36 5-inch squares and combo pack of both 5-inch and 10-inch squares.

boardgame.name: Dry Erase Dungeon Tiles, Graystone
boardgame.description:
From the website:

Not only do these tiles provide a more realistic stone floor appearance, they are accented with various dungeon floor features that include broken stones, moss, water, blood, and dirt that add character to your dungeon maps. R4I has taken the realistic visual effects even further by implementing a "hidden grid" by rendering a floor of varied size and shape stone tiles, yet still leaving a subtle representation of the traditional 1" grid. Compatible with both dry-erase and wet-erase markers. More flexible than a traditional battle mat, start your game with a single tile and connect the tiles as the adventurers explore new areas. Never again give away clues as to which way the corridors may lead due to starting placement on a large mat. The interlocking tile modularity allows the Dungeon Master to draw many details of an area at his seat and then simply hand the tile to the nearest player to connect. Take advantage of the double-side feature by pre-drawing map features before the game and only revealing tiles as they are encountered. You can draw one side as it appears naturally, and the other side that shows all the hidden traps and magic features when they are triggered.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Dressing - Outdoors
boardgame.description:
From the Website:

Quickly and easily populate your dungeon map with all sorts of highly detailed and colorful items using Role 4 Initiative's Dungeon Dressing. Each sheet contains dozens of vinyl stickers that are repositionable, reusable, and compatible with both dry- and wet-erase markers so they can be used on any battlemat or set of dungeon tiles.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Dressing - Furniture
boardgame.description:
From the Website:

Quickly and easily populate your dungeon map with all sorts of highly detailed and colorful items using Role 4 Initiative's Dungeon Dressing. Each sheet contains dozens of vinyl stickers that are repositionable, reusable, and compatible with both dry- and wet-erase markers so they can be used on any battlemat or set of dungeon tiles.

Quickly and easily populate your dungeon map with all sorts of highly detailed and colorful items using Role 4 Initiative's Dungeon Dressing. Each sheet contains dozens of vinyl stickers that are repositionable, reusable, and compatible with both dry- and wet-erase markers so they can be used on any battlemat or set of dungeon tiles.

boardgame.name: TTRPG Safety Toolkit: A Quick Reference Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Playing tabletop roleplaying games can be fun and fulfilling experiences. However, making sure that the GM, players, and potential audience feels safe is important.

This is a quick reference guide on how to incorporate safety tools into your TTRPG games to make sure that everyone is having fun.

User summary:

The Safety Toolkit document often is distributed as a ZIP archive containing numerous related resources.
boardgame.rpghonor: 2020 ENnie for Best Free Game/Product Gold Winner
2020 ENnie for Best Free Game/Product Nominee

boardgame.name: Support Tools Compilation
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a compilation of tools that help you learn how to support your friends in roleplaying. Before we even get to the tools, I’ve got some thoughts about support. I would appreciate it if you could bear with me and read them; if you’re in a rush, skip to the goods.


The first set of thoughts are: why does support matter? Why we care about it?
The second set of thoughts are: what is important in doing support? What do you need to know to support your friends effectively?
The third set of thoughts are: what happens when tools fail you? How can you build new tools or move past them?


After that is a glossary of terminology I will use throughout the document and then the list of tools themselves; some written by myself and some written by others.

boardgame.name: Script Change
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tabletop games are exciting and fun, and can explore adventures we otherwise might not have. However, they can approach topics that some people aren’t comfortable with. Some people might want to play a grittier game that digs deep into the grindhouse style of action, or one that has sex and romance that’s detailed and intimate, while others might want to have the gore and guts or sexual content happen off-screen.

Sometimes, we aren’t ready when this happens. Sometimes people don’t know all of their boundaries yet. Maybe they do, and they just aren’t expecting to kick down the door and find something that really makes them scared, or uncomfortable. This is where Script Change comes in.

The core Script Change tools are called rewind, fast forward, pause, and frame-by-frame. There are also some additional tools related to Script Change: the highlight reel, instant replay, and wrap meeting, discussed later in this document.

boardgame.name: Safety & Calibration Cards
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Roleplaying is improvised, and sometimes a game can go in an unexpected direction, or explore difficult subjects. These tools help players communicate their boundaries so they can continue to play in a way that’s still fun for everyone.

Not all techniques are appropriate for every style of play–some are better suited at the table than for live-action, and others may not be a good match for a given game. Some games may also have similar techniques already built in. As a facilitator, take some time to think about which tools would work best for your story. If playing a GM-less game, have a group discussion on which technique people prefer. You may only need just one, or you may want to combine a few.

It’s important to model and practice any tools you’re using before the game starts, so everyone is comfortable using them. Also, discuss as a group what might happen in this particular game that could prompt someone to need to use one of these tools. These techniques will only be successful if the group trusts each other and is committed to having healthy interactions.

Once a technique has been agreed upon by the group, it can be used by anyone, at any time, no questions asked. The appropriate response to someone stating their boundaries is “Thank you.”

boardgame.name: Safety Tools Cards
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

These cards are 2 x 3.5 inches and fit on Avery 8371 sized business cards.

The cards are designed to be double-sided, with the letter on one side and “SafetyToolsCardsBack.png” on the other.

User summary:

Safety Tools Cards present print-and-play N, O, and X cards. They are distributed with a one-page DOC "print guidelines", a 1-page PDF card back document, and three 1-page card documents.

Publisher's blurb:

X, N, and O cards are check-in tools. They can be used by tapping physical cards, typing the letter in the chat function of the video conference software or virtual tabletop you are using, or using hand signals. Before the game begins, remind everyone that they are available and how to use them.

The X card can be used at any point if a participant is uncomfortable with the content happening in-game. When the X card is used by tapping the card or typing an “X” in the chat, the group can change, rewind, or skip the content.

The N card can be used at any point if a participant feels like they are headed towards an X. When the N card is used by tapping the card or typing an “N” in the chat, the group can change the content or have the scene “fade to black.”

The O card can be used at any point if a participant wants to continue with the content. When the O card is used by tapping the card or typing an “O” in the chat, the group is ok to continue with the content. They can also regularly be prompted by a “O?” asked out loud or in the chat to check-in if everyone is still ok.

boardgame.name: The Full Deck Method
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For a slightly more discreet safety tool, split a deck among players evenly distributing the 4 suites.

Players can hand cards to each other or the GM depending on their needs.

boardgame.name: The Support Flower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Support Flower is a non-verbal affirmative-consent player support tool for tabletop gaming that allows for player to communicate boundaries without the feeling like they are disrupting the game.

boardgame.name: Code of Conduct for RPG Projects
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This document provides a Code of Conduct you can use in your RPG projects to create a safe and positive work environment. Information is provided for both Project Owners and Contributors to use the code.

The Code of Conduct for RPG Projects provides the following:


A code of conduct, based on best practices in this and other industries.
Information on why a code of conduct is beneficial to a project.
Suggestions on how either a Project Owner or a Contributor can introduce the code to a project.
Suggestions on how to use a code of conduct.
Permission for you to change and even redistribute the document, so long as you provide credit and it remains free.

boardgame.name: The Digital RPG Consent Checklist
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Digital RPG Consent Checklist is a google form that you can share with your players, who can fill it out anonymously. Sharing a Blank google form is a little more complicated than sharing a google doc, so I’ve made up this quick guide to using and sharing the form.

User summary:

The checklist itself is a Google form, somewhat like a questionnaire, that can be completed online and then delivered via e-mail. The "Read Me" document (DOCX format) contains instructions and links.

boardgame.name: KISHU
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The year is 1986. In the 18 years since the alien outworlders first made contact with humanity, the hypercapitalist Second Industrial Revolution has brought about an unstoppable climate apocalypse.

The remaining disparate landmasses of Earth are now connected over the radioactive sea by great bridges known as Ultrahighways. These treacherous asphalt frontiers are all that separates you and your gang from bringing a mysterious alien artifact to the People’s Resistance: humanity’s last hope to resist the bootheel of the global military police and the reign of the God-King Ronald Reagan.

Navigate the Ultrahighways, evade the empy, and withstand ravaging superstorms with nothing but your gang, your cycle, and a mission: deliver the artifact at all costs.

boardgame.name: The Legend of Ezmerelda
boardgame.description:
The Legend of Ezmerelda, is inspired by Nintendo’s popular RPG from 1986. 1 or more players explore the world while: meeting new allies, discovering dungeons, and combating throngs of enemies, in order to recover lost artifacts and return them to their owners.

Playing is a creative adventure that triggers the imagination as the story unfolds that is unique to each game. Use a six(6)-side die in combination with cards and maps to explore the world and recover artifacts, while gaining experience with their character and increasing various stats. Characters must observe the passage of time for practicing skills and abilities, 1 game hour is equal to 1 real-world minute.

1 or more players move 1 Hex plot at a time around the World map. If multiple players are working together in a party, 1 member is designated as the dice roller and the person to draw the cards. If entering a dungeon, the designated person draws cards to determine the enemies and rewards within. If entering a town, cards are drawn to determine which quests are available. During gameplay, each player's character can increase the values of certain skills and abilities on their character sheet and they may add or remove party members.

The game continues until the player(s) decide the game should end.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tormenta de Fuego
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tormenta de fuego es una aventura de fantasía y supervivencia en la que una vieja leyenda sobre tronos divinos puede ser la clave para vencer a los Oyhun, una raza semidivina que tiene esclavizadas al resto de las razas de Heyrä. Primer módulo de Descenso a las entrañas de la Bestia, una campaña para el juego de rol más grande de todos los tiempos. Cada compra incluye una descarga gratuita de la versión en pdf.

boardgame.name: El Valle de los Huesos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tras Tormenta de fuego, llega El Valle de los Huesos, la segunda parte de la campaña de fantasía en tres tomos Descenso a las entrañas de la bestia. La profecía ha sido revelada: el brahäna destinado a sentarse en el trono de la divinidad se encuentra en algún lugar del Valle de los Huesos. Pero solo un dios puede señalar a este elegido.

boardgame.name: El Trono de la Divinidad
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tercer y último tomo de la campaña de fantasía épica Descenso a las entrañas de la Bestia. Bajo el subsuelo de Veddara, en el tenebroso entramado de galerías y recónditas ciudades al que llaman Geoscuridad, se está gestando una inexorable contienda por alcanzar el último trono de los dioses. Nuestros héroes deberán llegar los primeros si quieren salvar un mundo que está siendo arrasado por los cataclismos, pero antes deberán sobrevivir a la Herrumbre y a otras criaturas letales.

boardgame.name: Suplemento para Tormenta de fuego
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Suplemento para la aventura de fantasía y supervivencia Tormenta de fuego. En este manual encontrarás una ciudad de Yrgäe completamente desarrollada y una versión de las infinitas posibilidades del asalto a Yrgäe repleto de escenas detalladas.

boardgame.name: Localizaciones en El Valle de los Huesos
Suplemento de localizaciones para El Valle de los Huesos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Este suplemento incluye todas las localizaciones de El Valle de los Huesos, más nuevas localizaciones creadas para ampliar las posibilidades de aventura en la ambientación de sangre y fuego de la campaña Descenso a las entrañas de la bestia.

boardgame.name: Suplemento Aventuras en Veddara
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Una antigua mazmorra en el fondo del Mar Ardiente, el acoso de un ejército de criaturas mutantes en las fronteras de las Tierras Medias, un juicio por asesinato en ese nido de criminales que es la ciudad de Narë. Tres aventuras electrizantes ambientadas en Veddara que amplían el universo legendario de la campaña Descenso a las entrañas de la Bestia.

boardgame.name: 15 Minutes to Self-Destruct
Escape in 15 Minuten
boardgame.description:
15 Minutes to Self-Destruct is a co-operative game of escaping a spaceship that is about to explode. Preferably before it explodes. The problem is, the self destruction sequence has been set by the ship's AI running wild, and that same AI is still trying to stop the players from fleeing. To successfully flee, the players have to activate the escape pod by turning on 13 switches all over the ship. To reach the switches they have to unlock the doors that block the way between them.

The way all this happens is simple: on your turn you can either roll the dice to unlock doors on your half of the ship OR move your astronaut through doors that have previously been unlocked. You try to reach the switches to be able to turn them on. Sometimes you roll a dice combination that you cannot use. When that happens you have to draw a card that may lock unlocked doors, or deactivate activated switches. To win the game, all astronauts have to reach the escape pod in the center of the board before the time has run out, after all switches have been turned on.

The game is played using a free timer app downloaded to a smartphone. The timer also plays atmospheric sounds that remind the players of the urgency of the situation.
