boardgame.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender D20 Role-playing Game (2008)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Avatar, a central figure in the world of Avatar: the Last Airbender, is perceived to be the physical incarnation of the spirit of the world. The Avatar serves to maintain a balance of power between the four human nations, promote peace and prosperity throughout the world, protect the environment, and bridge the gap between the world of the spirits and the physical world.

The Avatar's unique ability to master all four of the bending disciplines and use them in combination makes the Avatar extremely powerful. In addition to the disciplined mastery of all the elements, the Avatar can, in times of great danger or emotional stress, enter into a special "Avatar State," wherein the Avatar can call on the knowledge and power of all the past Avatars. The Avatar's eyes glow and his or her power increases substantially. The Avatar State even allows the Avatar to use bending abilities he or she would normally be unable to perform. Finally, through intense meditation, the Avatar can enter into the spirit world and interact with spirits.
boardgame.rpg: Avatar: The Last Airbender D20 Role-playing Game

boardgame.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender D20 Role-playing Game (2010)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Avatar, a central figure in the world of Avatar: the Last Airbender, is perceived to be the physical incarnation of the spirit of the world. The Avatar serves to maintain a balance of power between the four human nations, promote peace and prosperity throughout the world, protect the environment, and bridge the gap between the world of the spirits and the physical world.

The Avatar's unique ability to master all four of the bending disciplines and use them in combination makes the Avatar extremely powerful. In addition to the disciplined mastery of all the elements, the Avatar can, in times of great danger or emotional stress, enter into a special "Avatar State," wherein the Avatar can call on the knowledge and power of all the past Avatars. The Avatar's eyes glow and his or her power increases substantially. The Avatar State even allows the Avatar to use bending abilities he or she would normally be unable to perform. Finally, through intense meditation, the Avatar can enter into the spirit world and interact with spirits.
boardgame.rpg: Avatar: The Last Airbender D20 Role-playing Game

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 539 - Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 539
October 2020
Ignorable Theme: What makes an NPC
strike the players as a fascinating / wonderful / impressive Character? Should the GM be emotionally
invested?

boardgame.name: Not Fantasy Realms
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Beta Test version of not Fantasy Realms. Hop aboard and embark upon the maiden voyage of a unique role playing system, which borrows (hopefully the best) elements from many other game systems. The system facilitates the creation of unique and evolving characters. Unlike many systems, levels and character classes got chunked. Players build characters based upon a framework of randomly generated primary statistics, modified by racial attributes. Using Character Points, players purchase abilities with weapons, magic and skills, as well as character advantages. Players earn additional character points by role playing. Alignment does not exist as a strict Good versus Evil, Law versus Chaos system, but encompasses the character's personal morals and relationship with the universe.

User summary:

The oddly named Not Fantasy Realms is a fantasy roleplaying game published in HTML. Characters in the game have Attributes, Skills, and a Race. Characters additionally may have advantages and/or disadvantages. Character creation is a blend of random determination and player selection. Combat is fairly complex, including initiation, weapon vs. armor, weapon speeds, dual wielding, called shots, critical hits, etc.

The game was "illustrated" with images taken from other sites.

boardgame.name: Ombres de la Lune
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Ombre de la Lune ("Shadows of the Moon") is a French-language game that presents an unusual cyberpunk/fantasy fusion set on a peculiar, alternate Earth in the first century AD.

The game is published in HTML format, and consists of five separate HTML pages - one of which includes the full rules of the game; and one of which presents an extensive setting "Encyclopédie" (which is perhaps more interesting than the game itself).

Characters are defined primarily by Compétences and Caractéristiques (Force, Agilité, Dextérité, Perception, Intelligence, and Mental). Action resolution uses a fairly traditional modified die roll against a target number (the modifier used is typically summed values of Caractéristiques).

boardgame.name: Extra Metallic Dragons
boardgame.description:
"Want some extra Metallic Dragons outside of the traditional five offered in the Monster Manual, this supplement has you covered.

Includes 46 Monster Statblocks for Low-Level to High-Level encounters!

44 of which are Dragons! 2 are supplemental entities for dragons!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Råttkungens hov
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Råttkungens hov (The Rat King's Court) is a fan-made scenario taking place in the southwest part of Caldarox in the fantasy setting Ereb Altor.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Master's Screen: Wilderness Kit
boardgame.description:
From the back cover of the folio:

CHART A COURSE IN THE WILDS

This kit equips the Dungeon Master® with a screen and other tools that are perfect for running D&D adventures in the wilderness.

The Dungeon Master's screen features a gorgeous painting of fantasy landscapes on the outside, and useful rules references cover the inside of the screen, with an emphasis on wilderness rules.

The kit also includes the following:


5 dry-erase sheets, featuring hex maps, a food-and-water tracker, and rules references (wilderness chases, wilderness journeys, and the actions you can take in combat)
27 cards that make it easy to keep track of conditions, initiative, and environmental effects
1 box to hold the kit's cards

boardgame.name: Kulturspillet
boardgame.description:
A trivia game with 18 categories. Questions have a Danish bias. Played in up to six teams.

On your turn you answer a question in one of the categories of the square you are on. If you answer correctly, you roll the die and advance on the board.

—user summary

boardgame.name: A Mortal's Guide to Meir
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mortal's Guide to Meir is a unique steam-punk setting for 5e. This one-of-a-kind campaign world inspired by Victorian literature is perfect for swashbuckling, science fiction, dark fantasy, mythic fantasy, mystery, or intrigue adventures. This 279-page book contains all the tools you need to make adventures and characters that would be at home in the books of Robert Louis Stevenson, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, H.G. Wells, Jules Verne, Bram Stoker, Lewis Carroll, Alexandre Dumas, Rudyard Kipling, and other 19th century authors.

A Mortal’s Guide to Meir includes:

A world of steam, steel, and magic, with 9 separate nations and 62 settlements, each with its own unique adventure hooks.
Tips for creating different types of adventures that match different literary genres.
40 new races, including half-races, monstrous and aberrant races, and planar races
48 new subclasses, 4 for each of the 12 base classes, specifically designed for a Victorian steam-punk setting.
1 new class, the Voyager, with 4 subclasses. The Voyager embodies the courage and adventuresome spirit of the Victorian protagonist.
153 new backgrounds - one for every possible combination of two skill proficiencies.
26 new weapons, including firearms and explosives (and four new siege weapons).
Lots of new equipment, tools, and steam-powered technology.
5 new mounts and expanded and refined rules for mounted combat
15 new vehicles, including steam-powered vehicles and ships, and rules for creating custom ships.
140 new magic items.
New rules for weather and environment, including 22 natural hazards, to make the wilderness a treacherous foe.
Stat blocks for 55 new monsters and 21 unique NPCs, along with templates to create your own combined creatures, elemental-infused creatures, celestial or fiendish creatures, steam-powered constructs, and arctic, sea, and desert creatures.
87 new spells, along with special rules for discovering high-level spells and casting them as mass rituals involving multiple characters.

boardgame.name: Mine Shrine of Uldathil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of level 1

The Mine Shrine of Uldathil is inside a prosperous silver mine owned by the dwarven Hammershield clan. Recently, an earthquake opened a crevice in the mine, severing the cart tracks and trapping several miners inside. To make matters worse, the new crevice went deep enough to connect with tunnels farther underground which allowed a group of grimlocks to swarm up into the mine.

boardgame.name: Cold Mountain (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Mend A Frozen Heart?

A mother’s love is stronger than death, but love and death walk hand in hand when mortals cross paths with the immortal fey. Something has stirred up a fell and bloodthirsty power in the depths of the forlorn forest, and a bitter wind and mournful howls echoing from a lonely mountain bring a chilling dread to the wilds beyond the borderlands.

A goddess is angry, and her wrath heralds doom in the unforgiving lands of a savage frontier. Can the heroes find a way to make peace with the warlike clans of the lonely hills and quell the frightening powers of nature that threaten to rise up and devour scattered clan and nascent frontier kingdoms alike? With triumph and tragedy in the balance, do they dare ascend Cold Mountain?

Cold Mountain is a Pathfinder Second Edition adventure for 4th-level characters that takes the heroes past the reach of civilization, coming face to face with strange and primitive folkways and faerie powers. This adventure brings an evocative atmosphere of Dark Ages-style barbarism and mysticism into a traditional fantasy campaign, delivering challenges to overcome with words and deeds as well as on the field of battle. Your players will need cunning, guile, and a silver tongue to succeed where their magic and their sword arms may not prevail.

boardgame.name: Hidden Society Of The Gnomes: Invasion Cards
boardgame.description:
Gnome invasion has begun. The world is divided into two factions.

Will you help gnomes to restore their ancient glory and take over the world?
Will you help humans to dissipate such savagery, and repel this invasion?
Battle strategies need to be plotted as the future of the Earth is in your hands!

Hidden society of the gnomes: Invasion Cards, is an exhilarating semi-strategic card game for 2-4 players. (if 4 players, then 2 vs 2 teams)
Use your cleverness, traps and decoy maneuvers to overpower your opponent. Plot schemes, use some wit and count on some luck, cause only then you might come out as a winner!
This game is family friendly and suits all ages who can read!
Invasion Cards for collectors and competitive friends/family!

One game lasts 20-40 minutes!

All the cards are related to the book “Hidden society of the gnomes: Great Invasion”.
Some cards contain secret powers that can only be used when You have found the “effect” with the help of the book.
There are a few cards with hidden messages and secrets!
Two factions preforming actions:

Humans:

A mighty force to be reckoned with. Armed with an exceptional arsenal, they surely are a worthy enemy. This starter deck holds 60 cards of pure terror to stand against gnomes and their invasion. Use them wisely!

Gnomes:

The elite of the most elite. This fearsome army, with many futuristic superweapons, is ready. Gnome forces have prepared decades for this invasion. This starter deck holds 60 cards of regal power. Use them wisely!

Description:

Invasion Cards are here!
Take control and play as gnomes or humans. Defeat your opponent in a duel and get awarded with a privilege to live on this planet.
Two factions in a total of 120 cards will captivate players across the world. Be the one that prevails!

“Invasion has begun! Try your hand in fending off the invading forces or be the one who will destroy the humanity”

boardgame.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Arms and Armor (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this file:

This file covers all the weapons and armors available in the Amazons Vs Valkyries campaign setting. Some are slightly altered from the core rules, others are borrowed from other sources, and some are brand new.

New Armors Include:

Cardiophylax
Manica
Helm and greaves combo
Lamellar (3 types)
Linothorax (2 types)
Wicker and leather shields
Wearing weapons (as armor)


New Weapons Include:

Falx
Harpe
Kontos
Kopis
Makhaira
Pata
Plumbata
Rhomphaia
Sarissa
Scizore


The appendix offers some new feats for characters who prefer to do battle with no armor or clothing at all. These include:

Jaybird
Naked Aggression
Naked and Fearless


Pick this supplement up today and you just might survive a battle between the two most powerful warrior cults in the world!

boardgame.name: Die Eroberer (fan Expansion to Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
... and the time came when the rival princes of Carcassonne became more and more power-hungry and strove with all means for the crown of the dominion.
So they invented new ways of protecting their cities and weakening those of their opponents; they built longer roads and conquered farms than all the princes before them.
They did not even shy away from occult powers - despite their Christian cathedrals.
A new, dark age had dawned...

This expansion introduces the following features to Carcassonne:
- field path
- infinite crossing
- oracle
- siege
- watch tower
- ruin

boardgame.name: Back 2 School
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Back 2 School is the tenth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements."

It's a guide to university living in the gig economy. More specifically, it's a guide to University of California San Jenaro. You could use the information as a springboard for any university, but we're doing UCSJ because why not.

This book includes:

It starts with a guide to the campus, including a number of locations and story hooks for each.
Then we talk about the monsters of UCSJ. This includes some major characters from my novel Blood Flow, as well as some campus predators.
Then there's a job generator for campus gigs. Fun times.
Lastly, we feature an adventure kit for a gig set on UCSJ campus.

boardgame.name: Générateur de Pointcrawl - Extérieurs
Wilderness Pointcrawl Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This generator can be used to easily generate wilderness pointcrawls, small or huge.

The supplement contains:

A table of content
Lots of tables (ranging from d6 to d100!):
Biomes and Links
Points of Interest (300 entries!)
Settlements, Ruins, Lairs & Marvels

Concrete examples of how to craft a pointcrawl

boardgame.name: Arcade Fuzz
boardgame.description:
ARCADE FUZZ is a 2in1 combo with the Walter Machado's hardboiled titles TTV3 and WARPZONE DRIFTER.

TTV3 is fast-paced maze wanderer minigame with procedural maps and audio, with original gameplay and aesthetics.

WARPZONE DRIFTER is a physics-based drifting minigame. Moving tentacles, limited time, procedural levels and the inability to break are elements of the challenge.

Put your reflexes to the test with these games of the Brazilian underground indie game development scene.

(from Nintendo.com website)

boardgame.name: Belfort: Mayor's Key and Coins
boardgame.description: The Mayor's Key and Coins for Belfort includes a burgundy-colored cloth drawstring bag with "Belfort Royal Treasury" screen-printed on one side, a metal key, and 46 metal coins. It was first made available through the crowdfunding campaign for the 10th Anniversary Edition of Belfort.

boardgame.name: Thunderstone Quest: Darkness Rising
boardgame.description:
Count Mortas feeds off the life force of the citizens of Ebonwood, a pocket dimension shrouded in perpetual twilight. New heroes rise to take down the Count and they too can draw power from the darkness. But they must be careful, if they draw too much power that way all will be lost.

Darkness Rising introduces new Corruptions to Thunderstone Quest. These cards will be obtained by players, sometimes by choice, sometimes not. They grant great power, but at steep costs.

Darkness Rising is part of The Enemies Among Us, a 2-Quest Kickstarter also featuring Miricelle's Return.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Oldies But Goodies - Games I
boardgame.description:
A compilation containing:

Biorhytm
Factor
Number Scramble
Tictactoe
Word Scramble


(from the manual)

boardgame.name: Mirror, Mirror (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Mirror, Mirror is an old school D&D adventure placed in a fairy tale setting. King Nuno has summoned the party to track down the missing knight Sir Lucan, who vanished just as his nemesis, Zeroun the Enchanter, escaped from prison. The fate of the kingdom, and the happiness of Princess Ardella, lie in the hands of our brave adventurers, but not all is quite as it seems.

Stack of books with a lamp on topThis fairy tale is marked by a cast of complex characters who turn classic fantasy tropes on their ear, and challenge the players to navigate intertwined NPC relationships and moral gray areas. There are plenty of locations to explore and enemies to vanquish, but all against the backdrop of a complicated web of conflicting NPC motivations. DMs must be ready to portray a variety of unusual characters and help their players navigate a plot that cannot possibly end with everyone living happily ever after.

While this adventure includes extensive opportunities for roleplay and can be completed without players ever drawing a sword, there are also mysterious locales to explore and dangerous monsters to fight. Three unique locations and six custom keyed maps are included for the party that chooses to infiltrate by stealth or force rather than negotiation. The author makes no assumptions on how any party may approach the challenges, and gives ample resources that will thrill players of any taste.

boardgame.name: Wink
Wink: Nest of Spies
Wink: Nid d'Espions
boardgame.description:
You are agents, infiltrating a foreign country, and you must discreetly connect with your local contacts. You have their descriptions, and the Carnival will permit your operation to remain covert; it all seems easy… but beware: the counterintelligence services are on high alert!

Each turn, wink at your secret accomplice without being seen by the other players!

Your goal is for you and your new accomplice each turn to identify each other with a wink, but without being noticed by the other players. Each time you and your accomplice can discreetly recognize one another with a wink, you each score a point. Whenever you reveal the hidden connection between two other conspirators by intercepting their winking, you score both of the points they should have gotten!
This is not for the faint of heart: You must act quickly, keep your cool, and be daring!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Wink Publisher: 999 Games Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: Rock Band Fights Evil
boardgame.description:
Rock Band Fights Evil is the next game project from Pocket Option Games. In this game, players control a rock band attempting to escape demons from Hell, or the demons tracking down the cheapskates trying to skip out on their deal with the devil. It is a diceless 2-player game played on a hex map, involving movement and strategic placement of playing pieces.

Rock Band Fights Evil is a simple diceless game, with no luck or chance elements.

Setup - The Hell player places one demon in each hex that is not a corner (three hexes per map edge). The Rock Band player places the relic in the center of the map. He then places one member of the rock band in each hex adjacent to the relic, so that the band surrounds the relic.

Goal - The Rock Band player's goal is to move the relic off any map edge. The Hell player's goal is to get past the rock band and destroy the relic.

Turn Sequence - The Rock Band player chooses one token and moves that rocker any number of hexes in a straight line up to its Move trait. Under most circumstances, rockers cannot enter occupied hexes. After that rocker moves, he may attack. Each token has a unique method of attacking and defeating opponents, e.g. "kill each adjacent demon that has no Hell tokens next to it." When that rocker's move and attack have been resolved, play proceeds to the Hell player. The Hell player's turn sequence is identical to the Rock Band player's.

Move: Different pieces have different Move values, so the humans have to stay on their toes. Some people are a little quicker than others. We all had that one kid in school who always ended up on our team, but never could pull his own weight. For most of my childhood, I was that kid. Also, demons tend to be a lot quicker than humans. Life's like that.

Attack: After a unit moves, it can then Attack. This is a diceless act that depends entirely on the positioning of your unit.

Win Condition: The rockers are trying to retrieve a relic that they intend to use to free themselves from their contract. I won't ruin the surprise; read the books! Anyway, if the rockers can move the relic off the map, they win! If the demons ever are able to maneuver into a position to destroy the relic, they win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mirror, Mirror (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Mirror, Mirror is a 5e compatible D&D adventure placed in a fairy tale setting. King Nuno has summoned the party to track down the missing knight Sir Lucan, who vanished just as his nemesis, Zeroun the Enchanter, escaped from prison. The fate of the kingdom, and the happiness of Princess Ardella, lie in the hands of our brave adventurers, but not all is quite as it seems.

Stack of books with a lamp on topThis fairy tale is marked by a cast of complex characters who turn classic fantasy tropes on their ear, and challenge the players to navigate intertwined NPC relationships and moral gray areas. There are plenty of locations to explore and enemies to vanquish, but all against the backdrop of a complicated web of conflicting NPC motivations. DMs must be ready to portray a variety of unusual characters and help their players navigate a plot that cannot possibly end with everyone living happily ever after.

This adventure is scaled for Tier 2, though it could be adapted to different tiers of play by focusing on the story elements. Much of the adventure relies on social interaction, so it is entirely possible to complete without ever drawing a weapon. Characters will find individuals willing to negotiate throughout the adventure. There are no encounters in this adventure in which creatures attack an unknown party of adventurers on sight.

That said, there are also mysterious locales to explore and dangerous monsters to fight. Three unique locations and six custom keyed maps are included for the party that chooses to infiltrate by stealth or force rather than negotiation. The author makes no assumptions on how any party may approach the challenges, and gives ample resources that will thrill players of any taste.

boardgame.name: Avatar the Last Airbender Role-Playing Game (d20)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a lost age, the world is divided into four nations: the Water Tribes, the Earth Kingdom, the Fire Nation, and the Air Nomads. Within each nation, there is a remarkable order of men and women called the "benders" who can learn to harness their inborn talent and manipulate their native element. Bending is a powerful form combining martial art and elemental magic.

In each generation, only one bender is solely capable of controlling all four elements. That bender is the Avatar. The Avatar is the spirit of the world manifests in human form. When the Avatar dies, it reincarnates into the next nation in the cycle. Starting with the mastery of his or her native element, the Avatar learns to bend all four elements. Throughout the ages, the countless incarnations of the Avatar have served to keep the four nations in harmony.

Then, the firebenders attacked. Just as the world needed the Avatar the most, he mysteriously vanished. A hundred years later, the Fire Nation is near final victory in its ruthless war of world domination. The Air Nomads were destroyed, the Air Temples ravished, and all airbender monks eradicated. The Water Tribes were raided and driven to the brink of extinction. The Earth Kingdom remains and fights a hopeless war against the Fire Nation. Many believe the Avatar was never reborn into the Air Nomads and the cycle is broken.

boardgame.name: Valdar - World of Elemental Leylines
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Technology and Bending are two very important powers in Valdar and are equally common and go hand in hand. Most technology is powered, inspired, and created by bending. From the powerful Goblin warships of the sea and sky, to the Yssar warsubs, to the Klimshar and Alder airships that fly over the world for years on end. Technology is everywhere just as bending is. There are many technologies in Valdar, but the most significant (and the only ones discussed in depth here) are vehicles of the land, air and sea and ballistics and the chemicals that make those possible.

User summary:

Valdar - World of Elemental Leylines presents a fairly standard fantasy-fantasy genre setting infused with "bending" magical abilities - a concept borrowed from Avatar: The Last Airbender.

boardgame.name: Lord of the Rings Classes
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Lord of the Rings Classes presents fairly standard player resources to enable concepts derived from Middle-earth to be used with d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.5 Compatible).

Contents include new Classes (Archer, Barbarian, Rider, Mage, Ranger, Rogue, and Warrior); new Racial modifiers; and new Spells.

boardgame.name: Avatar Tabletop Role Playing Game (Based on Aberrant d10)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Despite the title, Avatar Tabletop Role Playing Game does not present a complete game. Instead, it is a lightweight adaptation of some elements of Avatar: The Last Airbender to Aberrant.

The primary focus is on a simple "bending" mechanic with an associated "chi-blocking" mechanic. Suggested damage ranges for several weapons also are included.

The document's formatting is rudimentary.

boardgame.name: Kabuto Sumo
boardgame.description:
Spring time in Japan means the return of the rhinoceros beetles — "Kabutomushi", which is Japanese for "helmet bug" — and their athletic contests of dominance. Out in the wild, you can find them butting heads trying to show off their strength and impress their insect friends with their wrestling skills. This is the origin of the phenomenal World Insect Wrestling Championship.

In Kabuto Sumo, you are one of the contending beetles that is battling for supremacy in the ring and your place in the pantheon of legendary wrestlers. The gameplay of Kabuto Sumo resembles the coin-pusher arcade games in which you strategically drop quarters and anxiously anticipate coins cascading off the platform. This game features a similar experience, with you trying to strategically slide pieces onto the board and push the other players out of the ring. It's an exciting combination of dexterity, strategy, and luck.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Golden Geek Light Game of the Year Nominee
2021 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Cardboard Time Episode 1: Alan's Adventureland, Dinogenics, Cartographers
Kabuto Sumo and Fire In the Library with Tony Miller
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Kabuto Sumo: Andre the Goliath Promo

New, in shrinkwrap I also sell the expansion

Including the Insect All-Stars expansion.
Shipping to Germany for 6 €, rest of EU around 16 €.

boardgame.name: Swaps and Traps
boardgame.description:
A Hat That Changes Everything

Mike is a decent man. An ordinary one, you might say. But he is no pushover when it comes to capturing the enchanted hat from his nemesis, Divider. You see, Divider’s hat changes everything, including the position and direction of the screen. Mike’s only hope is to collect the cursed keys, and catch Divider through different locations and traps. Portions of his world will swap, turn and even flip to give him one unique adventure.

Swaps and Traps is a fun game, which will challenge your platformer skills as well as your eyes and necks. As you collect a key in a scene, you also trigger the main trap of the game. Portions of your screen will swap, turn and even flip horizontally and vertically to give you one unique adventure.

Swaps and Traps has a retro vibe, with simple gameplay against high level difficulty.
- 3 Worlds: Let’s Jungle, Night Watch and Divider’s Den
- 100+ levels
- Insane bonus levels
- Playful music
- 100+ achievements
- An adventure to remember

Ready to get lost in a single screen?

(from Nintendo.com website)

boardgame.name: Avatar: The Second Age Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“Water. Earth. Fire. Air. Long ago, the four nations lived together in harmony. Then everything changed when the Fire Nation attacked. Only the Avatar, master of all four elements, could stop them, but when the world needed him most, he vanished. A hundred years passed and my brother Sokka and I discovered the new Avatar, an airbender named Aang. Although his airbending skills were great, he had a lot to learn before he was ready to save anyone. But from the first day I met him, I believed Aang would save the world. And you know what? I was right. With the help of his friends, Aang defeated Fire Lord Ozai and ended the Hundred Year War. Zuko, Ozai's son and our ally, became the new Fire Lord. Together with Earth King Kuei, Aang and Zuko promised to return the nations to harmony."

— Katara


Welcome to Avatar: The Second Age, a free conversion for the Fantasy Flight Games tabletop roleplaying game Genesys.
...
Although this rulebook is intended to be a full conversion, there are a substantial number of differences between the rules presented here and those found in the FFG rulebooks. Aside from the fact that The Second Age takes place in a completely different universe, there are several core changes made to the original mechanics to accommodate the Avatar setting.

Some of these changes are merely cosmetic in nature and the conversions were a simple matter of changing some words around. Other changes include updates and even entire overhauls to make the conversion as faithful as possible to the source material.

boardgame.name: Avatar: The Second Age Bending Cards
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Avatar: The Second Age Bending Cards are print-and-play components containing rules references for "bending". The cards are provided in four separate PDF documents (each page presents abt. 8 cards):


Air Cards (6 pp)
Earth Cards (8 pp)
Fire Cards (6 pp)
Water Cards (8 pp)

boardgame.name: LightRaider NET (Issue 14 - Dec 1998)
boardgame.description:
LightRaider NET
Issue 14
December 1998

boardgame.name: Adventure Master's Screen
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Adventure Master's Screen presents several panels of game data (esp. reference charts) that are intended for use as a print-and-play, DIY style screen. No art is provided.

boardgame.name: Deep State: High Society Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
Deep State: High Society is a promo mini-expansion that you can add to your games of Deep State.

The High Society is a closed club, admitting only members of the old dynasties that have not yet lost their influence and capital.

These families have centuries of experience in the behind-the-scenes of warfare and hold many secrets and privileges. By winning and retaining their support, you will put the full power of traditional institutions at your service.

During your turn, you may use your Action to capture a High Society card. It costs you 3 Agents.

At the end of the game, the player with the most High Society cards scores 20 Influence points. The second place for the number of High Society cards brings them 10 points. Next, 5 points for being third and no points for being late.

High Society is fully compatible with Deep State: New World Order and the Global Conspiracy expansion. It is designed for 1–5 player games. It comes packaged in its own zip-bag.

boardgame.name: Deep State: Ultimate Deep State Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
Ultimate Deep State is a promo mini-expansion that you can add to your games of Deep State.

The highest stage of a Project development brings world dominance. It may take radical forms that knock out any competition. No matter how powerful the ‘Committee’ is, it is vulnerable to its own subdivision heads.

Victory in a World Domination Project, including the total neutralization of the ‘Committee’ and all its structures, costs more and brings higher risks. Its reward is a clean slate... while sitting atop the world as its one and only ruler.

The Ultimate Deep State promo mini-expansion allows for instant victory when you reach Stage V in any Project, instead of winning with Influence. Each Stage V has higher requirements only experienced players can meet.

There is also a "soft" version — with less difficult requirements, Stage V grants more influence and no instant victory.

This expansion contains overlays for Stages V for the 4 base set Projects and the 6 Projects from the Global Conspiracy expansion. It is fully compatible with all modules and mini-expansions from the Deep State: Global Conspiracy expansion. It is designed for 1–5 player games. It comes packaged in its own zip-bag.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Adventure Master Archives
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Adventure Master Archives were an assortment of electronic resources distributed on floppy disk (later, as a self-extracting archive via file sharing) along a "shareware" model.

Earlier versions of Adventure Master Archives included a digital copy of the DragonRaid rules - this document voluntarily was removed at the request of the copyright holder.

The remaining contents of Adventure Master Archives include:


Read1st.DOC - an introduction to DragonRaid and enumeration of the archive
PManual.TXT - a brief introduction to the archive
Promo.TXT - short quotes and endorsements of DragonRaid
Prolog.TXT - brief presentation of Cornerstone, a variant campaign setting somewhat departing from Talania
Archive2.TXT - additional rules (secret doors, additional character races, undead monsters, etc.)
CCatalog.TXT - a "creature catalog" - minimal bestiary
MFile.WP - a text listing of new monster "stats"
Letter.TXT - a print-and-play game handout
Charshet.TXT - a print-and-play character sheet


The Archives also include two non-game documents:


MyWitness.TXT - the author's personal statement of faith
WashShow.TXT - a brief script for a theatric scene about God and George Washington
